protocol_name: 18S V4 tag sequencing PCR amplification and library prep (Illumina)
protocol_name_html: 18S V4 tag sequencing PCR amplification and library prep (Illumina)
description:
Protocol for PCR amplification of extracted cDNA or DNA and downstream library preparation for MiSeq sequencing.

 

See other related protocols for extraction of RNA and/or DNA from environmental samples

 

This protocol is specific to 18S rRNA gene tag sequencing targeting to V4 hypervariable region. We use V4 primers with Illumina adapters that then anneal to the P5 & P7 Illumina-specific indices. This barcoding step allows us to multiplex many samples for MiSeq sequencing. The V4 region is ~400bp, so we typically do MiSeq 250x250bp PE sequencing.
before_start:
1. Make fresh 80% ethanol. 
  2. Remove Agencourt AMPure XP beads from storage and let sit out at room temperature for at least 30 minutes. 
  3. Ensure the thermocycler is preheated to Q5 activation temperature 98ºC.
  4. Thaw appropriate materials on ice.

components.data:
We use Q5 High-Fidelity 2x Master Mix for our PCR reactions. The convenient 2x master mix formulation is easy to use and is suitable for PCR applications requiring greater accuracy and amplification of difficult or low genomic DNA concentrations. Depending on projects, we use anywhere between 1 ng to 10 ng input of DNA for a final concentration reaction mixture of .04 ng/ul to .4 ng/ul, respectively. 

 

 

Reagent  Volume  Stock Concentration  Final Concentration
Q5 High Fidelity 2x Master Mix  12.5 ul 2x  1x 
18S V4 Forward Illumina Adaptor  1.25 ul  10 uM .5 uM
18S V4 Reverse Illumina Adaptor  1.25 ul  10 uM  .5 uM
DNA Template  Variable    
Nuclease-Free Water   To 25 ul
components.name: Description

components.data: Amplification step with V4 primers (optional Illumina Adaptors for in house barcoding)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Amplification step with V4 primers (optional Illumina Adaptors for in house barcoding)

components.data:
Ensure the thermocycler is preheated to Q5 activation temperature 98ºC. 

Note: Depending on template size, annealing and extension temperatures and times may vary. Please refer to BioLabs Protocol for Q5 High-Fidelity 2x Master Mix thermocycler conditions. 

 

 

  Step  Temp Time  Cycles 
Step 1 Activation of Q5  98ºC  2 min  
Step 2 Denaturation  98ºC 10 sec  10x
Step 3  Annealing  53ºC 30 sec 

Step 4 

 Extension  72ºC 30 sec 

Repeat Steps 2 - 4 10 times 
Step 5  Denaturation 98ºC 10 sec  15x   
Step 6  Annealing  48ºC 30 sec
Step 7  Extension  72ºC 30 sec 
Step 8  Final Extension  72ºC 2 min  
Repeat Steps 5 - 6 15 times   
  Hold  4ºC
components.name: Description

Step 4 

 Extension  72ºC 30 sec 

Repeat Steps 2 - 4 10 times 
Step 5  Denaturation 98ºC 10 sec  15x   
Step 6  Annealing  48ºC 30 sec
Step 7  Extension  72ºC 30 sec 
Step 8  Final Extension  72ºC 2 min  
Repeat Steps 5 - 6 15 times   
  Hold  4ºC

components.data:
Remove Agencourt AMPure XP beads from storage and let sit out at room temperature for at least 30 minutes. 

 

Steps 3-19 can also be found with AgencourtsAMPure bead information.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove Agencourt AMPure XP beads from storage and let sit out at room temperature for at least 30 minutes. 

 

Steps 3-19 can also be found with AgencourtsAMPure bead information.

components.data: PCR Clean Up
components.name: Section

components.data: Vortex Agencourt AMPure XP beads for 1 minute to ensure the beads are evenly distributed prior to use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex Agencourt AMPure XP beads for 1 minute to ensure the beads are evenly distributed prior to use.

components.data: Make fresh 80% Ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make fresh 80% Ethanol.

components.data: Add 1:1 volume ratio of beads to PCR product (25 ul, if you're following this protocol) into each sample and pipette mix up and down 20-30x gently.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1:1 volume ratio of beads to PCR product (25 ul, if you're following this protocol) into each sample and pipette mix up and down 20-30x gently.

components.data: Let mixture sit at room temperature for 10-15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let mixture sit at room temperature for 10-15 minutes.

components.data: Place tubes onto magnetic stand for 2 to 5 minutes and let the beads clear from solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place tubes onto magnetic stand for 2 to 5 minutes and let the beads clear from solution.

components.data: With the tubes on the magnetic stand, add 200 ul of freshly prepared 80% Ethanol to each sample opposite the aggregated beads being careful not to disturb them.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: With the tubes on the magnetic stand, add 200 ul of freshly prepared 80% Ethanol to each sample opposite the aggregated beads being careful not to disturb them.

components.data: Incubate the tubes on the magnetic stand for 30 seconds and carefully remove the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the tubes on the magnetic stand for 30 seconds and carefully remove the supernatant.

components.data: With the tubes on the magnetic stand, add 200 ul freshly prepared 80% Ethanol to each sample well opposite the aggregated beads being careful not to disturb them.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: With the tubes on the magnetic stand, add 200 ul freshly prepared 80% Ethanol to each sample well opposite the aggregated beads being careful not to disturb them.

components.data: Incubate the tubes on the magnetic stand for 30 seconds and carefully remove the supernatant completely. Use a smaller volume pipette to remove any small amounts of ethanol collected at the bottom of the tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the tubes on the magnetic stand for 30 seconds and carefully remove the supernatant completely. Use a smaller volume pipette to remove any small amounts of ethanol collected at the bottom of the tubes.

components.data: Critical Step - With the tubes on the magnetic stand allow the beads to air-dry for 5 to 8 minutes. Make sure beads do not over dry and begin to crack.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Critical Step - With the tubes on the magnetic stand allow the beads to air-dry for 5 to 8 minutes. Make sure beads do not over dry and begin to crack.

components.data: Remove the tubes from the magnetic stand and add TE or nuclease-free water to each sample tube. Carefully pipette mix up and down for 20-30x.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tubes from the magnetic stand and add TE or nuclease-free water to each sample tube. Carefully pipette mix up and down for 20-30x.

components.data: Rehydrate sample tubes for 2-5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rehydrate sample tubes for 2-5 minutes.

components.data: Centrifuge sample tubes at 280 x g for 30 sec to collect solution in each tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge sample tubes at 280 x g for 30 sec to collect solution in each tube.

components.data: Immediately place the tubes on the magnetic stand for 2-5 minutes to allow magnetic beads to collect.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immediately place the tubes on the magnetic stand for 2-5 minutes to allow magnetic beads to collect.

components.data: Carefully transfer the supernatant to clean, labeled tubes. This is now cleaned up PCR product!
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully transfer the supernatant to clean, labeled tubes. This is now cleaned up PCR product!

components.data:
QC cleaned PCR products using Qubit fluorometer (concentration) High Specificity Dye & Buffer 

  • For the Qubit, load 2ul of product to 189 ul of High Specificity Dye & Buffer Solution for each sample
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
QC cleaned PCR products using Qubit fluorometer (concentration) High Specificity Dye & Buffer 

  • For the Qubit, load 2ul of product to 189 ul of High Specificity Dye & Buffer Solution for each sample

components.data:
We have P5 & P7 Index Primers in 5 uM stocks.

 

Note: Make sure to normalize total input PCR product (total ng) for amplification Step 22. 

 

Reagent  Volume  Stock Concetration  Final Concentration  
Q5 High Fidelity 2x Master Mix  12.5 ul  2x   1x 
P5 Indexed Primer  2.5 ul   5 uM .5 uM
P7 Indexed Primer  2.5 ul  5 uM .5 uM
DNA Template  Variable     
Nuclease - Free Water  Up to 25 ul
components.name: Description

components.data: Quantify cleaned up PCR product with bar
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Quantify cleaned up PCR product with bar

components.data:
After determining the DNA concentration in ng/ul, convert this value from ng/ul to nM using the average library size of your known template (including adaptor length). 

 

Calculate the conversion of ng/ul to nM using the following equation:

(ng/ul)*106/(660*library size)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

components.data: Manual Library Normalization & Pooling
components.name: Section

components.data:
Ensure the thermocycler is preheated to Q5 activation temperature 98ºC.

Note: Depending on template size, annealing and extension temperature and time may vary. Please refer to BioLabs Protocol for Q5 High-Fidelity 2x Master Mix thermocycler conditions. 

 

 

  Step  Temp Time Cycles
 Step 1  Activation of Q5   98°C  2 min   
 Step 2 Denaturation  98°C  10 sec  8x  
 Step 3  Annealing  54°C  30 sec
 Step 4  Extension 72°C  30 sec 
Repeat Steps 2-3 8 times
 Step 5 Final Extension   72°C  2 min   
  Hold  4°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Note: Depending on template size, annealing and extension temperature and time may vary. Please refer to BioLabs Protocol for Q5 High-Fidelity 2x Master Mix thermocycler conditions. 

 

 

  Step  Temp Time Cycles
 Step 1  Activation of Q5   98°C  2 min   
 Step 2 Denaturation  98°C  10 sec  8x  
 Step 3  Annealing  54°C  30 sec
 Step 4  Extension 72°C  30 sec 
Repeat Steps 2-3 8 times
 Step 5 Final Extension   72°C  2 min   
  Hold  4°C

components.data: PCR Thermal Profile for Step 22
components.name: Section

components.data:
Determine the common concentration to dilute your samples in nM. For Illumina sequencing platforms, we prefer to dilute our samples to 10 nM starting concentration. Check with your sequencing center on how they prefer to receive samples for sequencing. 

 

Calculate the dilution of your libraries using the following equation: 

(C1)(V1)=(C2)(V2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
